title: Man Utd chief Ed Woodward claims he did NOT tell Phil Jones 'we're on camera, stop' at West Ham
text:
Manchester United executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward has clarified that he did not tell Phil Jones 'we're on camera, stop' during their loss at West Ham.

There were suggestions on social media that the United chief had scolded the central defender because Jones had appeared to mutter 'sacked in the morning' while they were losing.

The exchange was caught by the Sky Sports cameras and Woodward seemed to tell Jones off.

Manchester United chief Ed Woodward appeared to scold Phil Jones at West Ham this season

Jones appeared to say 'sacked in the morning' before Woodward turned around and replied

In an interview with fanzine United We Stand, Woodward clarified the conversation and gave his version of events.

He said: 'Phil was talking about whether decisions were offside or not.

'There was a foul and I turned around to Rebecca Britain, our club secretary [and said]: "Was that a yellow card on him? [Issa] Diop?"'

Woodward has come under criticism this season for United's struggles, which sees them just two points above the relegation zone and with only two Premier League wins to their name.

But Woodward has said he turned around to club secretary Rebecca Britain to ask a question

They did manage to earn a draw against runaway leaders Liverpool on Sunday.

United will travel to Partizan Belgrade for a Europa League group stage game on Thursday evening.

After that, Ole Gunnar Solskjaer takes his side into a Premier League clash against relegation battlers Norwich City at Carrow Road.
description: There were suggestions on social media the Manchester United chief had scolded Phil Jones because the defender appeared to mutter 'sacked in the morning' while they were losing.
